ygData.subject: Re: OOC: Possible changes.
ygData.msgSnippet: I was wondering about Tucson s size, due to his dragon beast form.  Will it change in scale?  Dragons are usually rather large creatures.  Just curious. Local

I was wondering about Tucson's size, due to his dragon beast form.  Will it=
 change in scale?  Dragons are usually rather large creatures.  Just curiou=
s.

Local artist who specializes in illustration, using traditional and dig=
ital media.  

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasi=
on!  

Need a great gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at t=
his address and we will talk.  

On Apr 30, 2012, at 12:41 PM, Super Cyclon=
us <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> Hey all! :)
> 
> I am sorry about th=
e delay in posting. I am taking time to set myself
> up for another set of =
storylines, and am trying to do a better job of
> writing down my basic lin=
es before I jump in :)
> 
> So I apologize for delays, please give me anoth=
er day or so to be set.
> 
> One thing I have been discussing with Airly is=
 allowing for the larger
> sizes here. There was an old rule that everyone =
had to be Beastwars
> sizes, but I think I am going to fudge that one a bit=
.
> 
> I am planning on shifting us to more of a movieverse size scale. If
=
> you look at the IDW and the 3H comics that did Beastwars, they mention
> =
the size change, but never say how much and Rodims and Primal appear
> to b=
e nearly the same sizes. I think Primal is BIGGER
> 
> So here is a size sc=
ale that I might be inclined to use:
> http://tfwiki.net/w2/images2/6/67/RO=
TF_Autobot_scale_guide_1.jpg
> 
> It is based on the ROTF so I think it wil=
l work. This way we can range
> anywhere from about human sized for some of=
 the really small Maximals
> and Predacons to the really large.
> 
> My que=
stion is: What do you guys think? Do you think this could be
> something th=
at would work for your own character concepts?
> 
> There are differences b=
etween Autobots and Maximals as Maximals (and
> Decepticons and Predacons) =
generally the Maximals (and Predacons) are
> smaller (although not always) =
and generally do not size change much
> and are more energy efficient.
> 
>=
 Please let me know your ideas. I would like to know how you feel since
> t=
his is as much your world as it is mine.
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-0C4D3331-0DBD-4700-96B7-E3E095EECC81

 id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>Hey all! :)<br>
<br>
I am sorry a=
bout the delay in posting. I am taking time to set myself<br>
up for anothe=
r set of storylines, and am trying to do a better job of<br>
writing down m=
y basic lines before I jump in :)<br>
<br>
So I apologize for delays, pleas=
e give me another day or so to be set.<br>
<br>
One thing I have been discu=
ssing with Airly is allowing for the larger<br>
sizes here. There was an ol=
d rule that everyone had to be Beastwars<br>
sizes, but I think I am going =
to fudge that one a bit.<br>
<br>
I am planning on shifting us to more of a=
 movieverse size scale. If<br>
you look at the IDW and the 3H comics that d=
id Beastwars, they mention<br>
the size change, but never say how much and =
Rodims and Primal appear<br>
to be nearly the same sizes. I think Primal is=
 BIGGER<br>
<br>
So here is a size scale that I might be inclined to use:<b=
r>
<a href=3D"http://tfwiki.net/w2/images2/6/67/ROTF_Autobot_scale_guide_1.=
jpg">http://tfwiki.net/w2/images2/6/67/ROTF_Autobot_scale_guide_1.jpg</a><b=
r>
<br>
It is based on the ROTF so I think it will work. This way we can ra=
nge<br>
anywhere from about human sized for some of the really small Maxima=
ls<br>
and Predacons to the really large.<br>
<br>
My question is: What do =
you guys think? Do you think this could be<br>
something that would work fo=
r your own character concepts?<br>
<br>
There are differences between Autob=
ots and Maximals as Maximals (and<br>
Decepticons and Predacons) generally =
the Maximals (and Predacons) are<br>
smaller (although not always) and gene=
rally do not size change much<br>
and are more energy efficient.<br>
<br>
P=
lease let me know your ideas. I would like to know how you feel since<br>
t=
his is as much your world as it is mine.<br>
<br>
- Preston<br>
</p>
